alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 2:08PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A WINTER STORM ARRIVES TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY IMPACTING NORTHERN COLORADO... .A system will bring potentially heavy snowfall across the Front Range starting in the higher elevations Tuesday. Snow begins in the foothills and northern I-25 corridor starting late Tuesday night. The heaviest snowfall will occur in Park Range and the Larimer county foothills. This will likely lead to periods of poor visibility and difficult travel conditions especially in the Colorado high country. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY UNTIL 5 AM THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...From 11 AM Tuesday morning through 5 AM Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
